bibl.title: Five Tax Receipts From Early Islamic Egypt.
bibl.note: 1. P. Bodl. Ms.Gr.class. g. 10 (P). Διάγραφον paid through a ζυγοστάτης. Arsinoe, VII. - 2. P. E.E.S. Inv. 89A/113 (a). A φιλόπονος and his δημόσια. Arsinoe, VII/VIII. - 3. P. Iand. Inv. 516. The διάγραφον of a priest and a new city (?) quarter. Arsinoe / Oxyrhynchus (?), VIII. - 4. P. Iand. Inv. 18 recto. Hermopolite tailors and their ἀνδρισμός. Hermopolis, VIII. - 5. P. CtYBR [= P. Yale] Inv. 884. A priest and a deacon in a receipt for διάγραφον. Upper Egypt (?), VIII.
bibl.seg: 141.4 P. Bodl. Ms.Gr.class. g. 10 (P) P. E.E.S. Inv. 89A/113 (a) P. Iand. Inv. 18 recto; 516 P. Yale Inv. 884
GONIS Nikolaos, Five Tax Receipts From Early Islamic Egypt.

1. P. Bodl. Ms.Gr.class. g. 10 (P). Διάγραφον paid through a ζυγοστάτης. Arsinoe, VII. - 2. P. E.E.S. Inv. 89A/113 (a). A φιλόπονος and his δημόσια. Arsinoe, VII/VIII. - 3. P. Iand. Inv. 516. The διάγραφον of a priest and a new city (?) quarter. Arsinoe / Oxyrhynchus (?), VIII. - 4. P. Iand. Inv. 18 recto. Hermopolite tailors and their ἀνδρισμός. Hermopolis, VIII. - 5. P. CtYBR [= P. Yale] Inv. 884. A priest and a deacon in a receipt for διάγραφον. Upper Egypt (?), VIII.
